resources.string: Daily Facts

Octopuses Have Three Hearts
A Day on Venus Is Longer Than a Year on Venus
The Great Wall of China Is Over 13,000 Miles Long
Bananas Are Berries, But Strawberries Aren\'t
Honey Never Spoils
The Shortest War in History Lasted 38 Minutes
The Sun\'s Mass Makes Up 99.86% of Our Solar System
A Group of Flamingos Is Called a Flamboyance
Cows Have Best Friends
The World\'s Largest Desert Used to Be a Sea
The Loudest Sound Ever Recorded Was a Volcanic Eruption
The Mantis Shrimp Can Punch with the Force of a Bullet
A Single Strand of Spaghetti Is Called a Spaghetto
A Cat\'s Brain Is 90% Similar to a Human\'s
Your Taste Buds Change Every 10 to 14 Days
Humans Share 50% of Their DNA with Bananas

The World\'s Oldest Known Recipe is for Beer
In the 16th Century, Turkish Women Could Initiate Divorce for Lack of Coffee
The First Recorded Game of Baseball Was in 1846
Lighters Were Invented Before Matches

The Original Name of Bank of America Was "Bank of Italy"

The Most Common Language in the World Is Mandarin Chinese
Cleopatra Was Greek, Not Egyptian
The Oldest Living Organism on Earth Is Over 80,000 Years Old
Explore the intriguing fact that hippopotamus sweat is red.
Learn why the Eiffel Tower can change height with the seasons.
Dive into the biology of octopuses and their multiple hearts.
Discover why a day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Uncover the incredible length of the Great Wall of China.
Explore the surprising categorization of fruits.
Delve into the timeless properties of honey that never spoil.
Learn about the remarkably short Anglo-Zanzibar War.
Understand the massive contribution of the sun\'s mass in our solar system.
Find out what a group of flamingos is called.
Discover the social connections of cows and their best friends.
Uncover the fascinating transformation of the world\'s largest desert.
Witness the power of volcanic eruptions and the loudest sound ever recorded.
Learn about the incredible punching power of the mantis shrimp.
Find out the singular form of spaghetti.
Discover the surprising similarity between a cat\'s brain and a human\'s.
Learn how your taste buds regularly change, affecting your palate.
Explore the genetic connection between humans and bananas.
Understand the frozen landscape of the world\'s largest desert, Antarctica.
Learn about the world\'s oldest known recipe for beer.
Discover how coffee played a role in Turkish women\'s divorce rights in the 16th century.
Find out about the first recorded game of baseball in 1846.
Learn that lighters were invented before matches.
Explore the chilling record of the coldest temperature on Earth.
Discover the original name of Bank of America as "Bank of Italy."
Learn that jellyfish are composed of 95% water.
Explore the continuous emission of neutrinos by the sun.
Understand that the most common language in the world is Mandarin Chinese.
Learn that Cleopatra was of Greek descent, not Egyptian.
Discover the incredible longevity of the world\'s oldest living organism.
Hippopotamus sweat contains a red pigment, giving it a reddish hue.
The Eiffel Tower can expand in height by up to 15 centimeters during the hotter summer months.
Octopuses have three hearts: two pump blood to the gills, and one pumps it to the rest of the body.
A day on Venus, due to its slow rotation, is actually longer than a year on Venus.
The Great Wall of China stretches over 13,000 miles, making it the world\'s longest wall.
Botanically, bananas are considered berries, while strawberries are not.
Honey has an indefinite shelf life and does not spoil, even after thousands of years.
The Anglo-Zanzibar War of 1896 holds the record for the shortest war, ending in just 38 minutes.
The mass of the sun makes up 99.86% of the total mass in our solar system.
A group of flamingos is referred to as a "flamboyance."
Cows form strong social bonds with other cows, often having best friends within their herds.
Antarctica, with its frozen landscape, is the world\'s largest desert, while the Sahara is the largest hot desert.
The loudest sound ever recorded was produced by the eruption of the Krakatoa volcano in 1883.
The mantis shrimp can deliver a punch with the force of a .22 caliber bullet, making it one of the fastest and most powerful predators in the ocean.
A single strand of spaghetti is known as a "spaghetto."
A cat\'s brain is remarkably similar to a human\'s, sharing about 90% of its structure.
The taste buds on your tongue are replaced every 10 to 14 days, allowing your palate to evolve over time.
Humans share approximately 50% of their DNA with bananas, due to shared genetic building blocks.
Antarctica, with its frozen landscape, is the world\'s largest desert, while the Sahara is the largest hot desert.
The world\'s oldest known recipe, dating back over 3,900 years, is for beer and is recorded on a Sumerian tablet.
In the 16th century, Turkish women could initiate divorce for lack of coffee from their husbands.
The first recorded game of baseball took place in Hoboken, New Jersey, in 1846.
Lighters were invented before matches. The first lighter was developed in the early 1820s, predating friction matches.
The coldest temperature ever recorded on Earth was -128.6°F (-89.2°C) in Antarctica in 1983.
The original name of Bank of America was "Bank of Italy" when it was founded in 1904.
Jellyfish are composed of 95% water, which contributes to their gelatinous appearance.
The sun emits neutrinos continuously as a byproduct of its nuclear fusion processes.
Mandarin Chinese is the most commonly spoken language in the world, with over a billion native speakers.
Cleopatra, the famed queen of Egypt, was of Greek descent, not Egyptian.
The oldest living organism on Earth is a colony of quaking aspen trees in Utah, estimated to be over 80,000 years old.
Day %1$d
